-e ---

9 nine bows

Traditional Egyptian name for a confederation of 9 enemy tribes/nations.

𓌔 𓌔 𓌔 𓌔 𓌔 𓌔 𓌔 𓌔 𓌔 | the Nine Bows (traditional enemies of Egypt) |

𓊪 𓋴 𓆓 𓏥 𓏥 𓏥 | nine | psjt phosdj: 'the nine' / phoi.set 2+7
𓊪 𓋴 𓆓 𓏏 𓏨 𓏨 𓏨 | group of nine |
𓊪 𓋴 𓆓 𓈒 𓏏 𓏥 𓏥 𓏥 | group of nine | Poseidonine ?

𓌔 𓏏 𓏥 𓏥 𓏥 | the Nine Bows | vs bowtan ⇔ Boten Boaten, Ten-Bows
𓌔 𓏏 𓌙 𓀀 𓁐 𓏥 | (collective n.) foreigners | bowtan ⇔ Boten Boaten, Ten-Bows
𓌔 𓏏 𓏤 𓌙 𓀀 𓏥 | (collective n.) troop (of soldiers) |

Compare with Chinese Chiyou (蚩尤), leader of the Nine Li tribe (九黎). Arch Enemy of the first Chinese Dynasty, the Xia.

The Shu of Sichuan, who conquered the Shang, had a bronze bird tree with nine flower buds and nine birds on them.
